comments:
Hi
 I am trying to creating webservice(Bottom up) based on the instruction given in this link.
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/initial-contribution/IBM/evalGuides/WebServicesToolsEval.html?p=1
 I am trying to cretae a webservice for a simple Java bean.
 
 I am getting following error
 
IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.
  org/apache/tools/ant/Task
      java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/tools/ant/Task
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:539)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.DefaultClassLoader.defineClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:370)
      at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.defineClass(EclipseClassLoader.java:233)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.DefaultClassLoader.findClassImpl(DefaultClassLoader.java:343)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.DefaultClassLoader.findClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:235)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.AbstractClassLoader.findLocalClass(AbstractClassLoader.java:183)
      at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.basicFindLocalClass(EclipseClassLoader.java:141)
      at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.findLocalClass(EclipseClassLoader.java:72)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findLocalClass(BundleLoader.java:337)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.SingleSourcePackage.loadClass(SingleSourcePackage.java:37)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:386)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java:350)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.AbstractClassLoader.loadClass(AbstractClassLoader.java:78)
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:235)
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:302)
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
      at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:539)
      at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.DefaultClassLoader.defineClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:370)
      at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseClassLoader.defineClass(EclipseClassLoader.java:233)

I checked the project class path and ant.jar is included in Project build path.
It looks the class not found error is happening at the time of creating WSDL file.
Is there any plugin I have to add or I am missing some thing.
Any help on this is appriciated and I a struck in my work?

I am using Eclipse3.1.2,Tomcat-5.5.x,and downloaded WST 1.0 for eclipse and I followed the instruction while downloading WST1.0.

If you are running WTP 1.0, would you please try following the tutorials for WTP 1.0 [1] instead of the "initial contribution" tutorials which are all but obsolete and, strictly speaking, only applicable to the initial contribution download (which predates WTP 1.0 significantly)? Also, if you literally meant "WST", please download WTP (not just WST), since all the Java Web services tools live in the "JST" layer, and the complete WTP download includes WST+JST (sorry about all the acronyms).

If, after trying the WTP 1.0 tutorials on WTP 1.0 you get the same problem, please do re-open this bug.

Thanks - CB.

[1] http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/community/communityresources.html#tutorials

I was trying to create webservice same like what you adviced.
I followed WTP 1.0 tutorials on WTP 1.0 document to create the Bottom up webservice.
It looks there is some issue with classloader???
Please help me in that i am almost in no man place?

Parthi

The same problem began occuring and was fixed midway thru WTP 1.5 development, and was due to errors in org.apache.axis' manifest.mf file, however, no others have reported this on WTP 1.0. This is probably an environmental or installation glitch of some sort. Note that whether ant.jar is on the project build path isn't actually relevant, since this is a plugin/bundle loading problem, not a Java project resource loading problem.

Please check your installation and make sure plugins org.apache.axis, org.apache.ant and org.apache.tomcat are all present. I will also attach the manifest.mf file from org.apache.axis in the WTP 1.0 SDK for you to compare yours with.

Another possibility is that you reported running WTP 1.0 with Eclipse 3.1.2. Strictly speaking, WTP 1.0 prereqs Eclipse 3.1.1. The Eclipse 3.1.2 maintenance release should not in theory cause any issues, but the possibility does exist.

If the plugins exist and the manifest.mf files match, please try downloading a fresh WTP 1.0 SDK over Eclipse 3.1.1 (not 3.1.2) [1] targetting a fresh workspace, and try the bottom-up scenario described in the tutorial once again.

[1] http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/webtools/downloads/drops/R-1.0-200512210855/wtp-all-in-one-sdk-1.0-win32.zip

Hi
 I was doing the same way as you specified and i am getting that error.
 I checked comparing manifest file under plugin of ant and it looks both are same(compared one which comes with u r bundle and mine).
 The only difference is i am running under eclipse 3.1.2.
 Is theer any issue with classloader of plugins??

 Any help please.

Parthi

I can't really comment on whether there are issues with Eclipse's classloaders, since that's a question better posed to the Platform team, though OSGi is new enough to Eclipse that there could be some subtle difference in loading behaviour between platforms. The quickest way to test the theory is for you to try your scenario using WTP 1.0 over Eclipse 3.1.1, that is, to use exactly the prereqs specified by WTP 1.0 and on a *new workspace*.
Assigned to you, Kathy. Thanks - CB.
